summary: This is an FBI Public Affairs News Briefing from April 26, 2021, summarizing major news stories across various categories including Capitol violence investigations, criminal cases, and other national security matters. It includes a brief update on Ghislaine Maxwell pleading not guilty to new sex trafficking charges related to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: British socialite who pleaded not guilty to new sex trafficking charges stemming from her time with Jeffrey Epstein, including trafficking a 14-year-old girl.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Disgraced financier with whom Ghislaine Maxwell was associated; the sex trafficking charges against Maxwell relate to her time with him.

persons.name: Matt Gaetz
persons.context: Republican Congressman under investigation by DOJ prosecutors regarding a 2018 trip to the Bahamas and whether he took gifts in exchange for political favors.

persons.name: Halsey Beshears
persons.context: Appointed head of Florida's Department of Business and Professional Regulation; mentioned in connection with the investigation into Matt Gaetz's 2018 Bahamas trip.

persons.name: Jason Pirozzolo
persons.context: Doctor and medical marijuana entrepreneur mentioned in connection with the investigation into Matt Gaetz's 2018 Bahamas trip.

persons.name: Merrick Garland
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of signaling more investigations into local police departments and being pressured to release 9/11 links to Saudi Arabia.

persons.name: Christopher Wray
persons.context: Mentioned as being pressured to release 9/11 links to Saudi Arabia and in the context of House Republicans questioning intelligence agency leaders.

persons.name: Kash Patel
persons.context: Pushed back against a Washington Post column alleging he leaked classified information; credited with uncovering FBI surveillance abuses.

connections.description: Maxwell's sex trafficking charges stem from her time with Epstein, allegedly recruiting and grooming minors for him.
Both were involved in a 2018 trip to the Bahamas that is under investigation by the DOJ.
Both were involved in a 2018 trip to the Bahamas that is under investigation by the DOJ; connected through medical marijuana legislation and GOP fundraising.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Pleads Not Guilty
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell pleaded not guilty to new sex trafficking charges, including trafficking a 14-year-old girl for Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Gaetz Bahamas Trip Under Investigation
events.description: DOJ prosecutors are investigating a 2018 trip to the Bahamas involving Rep. Matt Gaetz and several young women, examining if it was part of an effort to illegally influence Gaetz regarding medical marijuana.

events.title: Capitol Siege
events.description: The document references numerous arrests and investigations related to the January 6, 2021, attack on the U.S. Capitol, including over 400 suspects charged.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell pleaded not guilty to new sex trafficking charges, including an allegation she trafficked a 14-year-old girl for Jeffrey Epstein as recently as 2004.
DOJ prosecutors are investigating a 2018 trip to the Bahamas involving Rep. Matt Gaetz, examining whether gifts were exchanged for political favors related to medical marijuana.
Over 400 suspects had been arrested in connection with the January 6, 2021, Capitol siege, with many having military, law enforcement, or government ties.
The FBI and DOJ were under pressure to release documents regarding the Saudi government's role in the September 11, 2001, terrorist attacks.
The news briefing covers a wide range of other national stories including the Derek Chauvin trial, COVID-19 pandemic updates, and various cybercrime and counterintelligence matters.
